summary: Interactive romantic Valentine proposal web page (HTML/CSS/JS) with Yes/No buttons, evasive No hover behavior, and a meme reveal on Yes; optimized to run locally on iPad Chrome.
architectural_notes: Single-page static HTML/CSS/JS designed to run locally in Chrome on iPad (no backend required).
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Romantic meme-style image with the text "Good choice" in a bold, high-contrast meme caption style on a pink/white themed background (valentine-good-choice-meme.dim_1024x1024.png)

existing_features.title: Create a single-screen, romantic-themed Valentine proposal page that asks: "Will you be my Valentine?" and presents exactly two options: "Yes" and "No".

Implement an evasive "No" button interaction: when the user attempts to hover or otherwise interact with the "No" button (e.g., pointer enter / touch start), it moves to a new position so it cannot be clicked.
When the user clicks "Yes", replace the choice UI with a confirmation view that displays a meme image and the message "Good choice".
Apply a romantic pink-and-white theme across the page (background, typography, buttons, spacing) with a clean, simple layout optimized for iPad Chrome.
Add the generated meme image to the frontend as a static asset under frontend/public/assets/generated and render it directly from the frontend (not via the backend).

new_feature_requests.summary: Build a simple romantic-themed Valentine webpage with Yes/No options; No button moves away on hover; Yes click reveals a 'Good choice' meme image; pink/white theme; runnable in iPad Chrome via HTML/CSS/JS.

projectName: Romantic Valentine proposal page with evasive No button and meme reveal
